title: How to Get to the Isle of Thunder in World of Warcraft

steps.title: Go to your faction’s shrine.
steps.content: Go to your faction’s shrine. Don't try to fly to the Isle of Thunder—you'll be blocked by impenetrable mists and die of exhaustion! Instead, start at your faction's shrine to get your first quest. Alliance members must go to Shrine of Seven Stars, while Horde members must go to Shrine of Two Moons. [2] X Research source You'll need to be at max level and have the WoW Mists of Pandaria patch (5.2) patch to get to the Isle of Thunder.

steps.title: Accept the Thunder Calls quest.
steps.content: Accept the Thunder Calls quest. If you're Alliance, you'll get the quest from Lyalia. If you're Horde, you'll get the quest from Sunwalker Dezco. You'll be told that it's time to attack the Thunder King, and that you should report to your faction camp in Townlong Steppes. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Head to your faction camp outside Shado-Pan Garrison in the central region of Townlong Steppes.
steps.content: Head to your faction camp outside Shado-Pan Garrison in the central region of Townlong Steppes. The Alliance camp is near the shore north of the garrison, while the Horde camp is south of the garrison. This is where you'll find the quest giver for The Storm Gathers, your next quest. If you are Horde, go to 50.7, 73.4 to find the quest giver. If you are Alliance, you'll find the quest giver at 49.7, 68.7.

steps.title: Speak with Vereesa Windrunner to start The Storm Gathers quest.
steps.content: Speak with Vereesa Windrunner to start The Storm Gathers quest. Once you get the quest, Vereesa will accompany you to the Isle of Thunder. You only have to do this one time—after finishing the quest, you'll be able to take the portal to the Isle of Thunder from Shado-Pan Garrison. [4] X Research source
